bcm.interfaces.battery

Interface BatteryI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentServiceI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.DataOfferedI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.DataRequiredI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedI, java.rmi.Remote, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredI

    public interface BatteryI
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.DataOfferedI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.DataRequiredI
    this class defines the interface BatteryI that defines the differnet methods represneting the Battery behaviour
    Author:
    Julien Xavier et Alexis Belanger

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void receivePower(double power) 
      void sendChargePercentage(double percentage)
      This method is called by the Battery Outboundport and calls the Controller OutboundPort getBatteryChargePercentage method to get the battery charge level
      void sendEnergy(double energy)
      This method is called by the Battery Outboundport and calls the Controller OutboundPort getBatteryProduction method to get the battery energy production
      void startBattery()
      This method is called by the Controller Outboundport and calls the Battery OutboundPort startBattery method to start the battery
      void stopBattery()
      This method is called by the Controller Outboundport and calls the Battery OutboundPort stopBattery method to stop the battery

      • sendChargePercentage

        void sendChargePercentage(double percentage)
                   throws java.lang.Exception

        percentage - the current purcentage of energy remaining in the battery
